intro: Calendula maroccana subsp. murbeckii, commonly known as Moroccan marigold, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are hairy and gray-green, while the flowers are often borne in clusters. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
